issue_title: Remove bar at the top requesting Github Permissions and Credentials.

scoping_result.summary: Remove the RepoConfig credentials bar component from the UI and replace user-entered values (owner, repo, token) with environment variables loaded from a .env file. The GitHub client already partially supports this pattern.

action_plan.description: Update .env.example to include NEXT_PUBLIC_GITHUB_OWNER and NEXT_PUBLIC_GITHUB_REPO variables alongside the existing token variable
Modify src/app/page.tsx to read owner, repo, and token from environment variables instead of useState, removing the RepoConfig component usage
Remove or deprecate the RepoConfig component since it will no longer be needed
Update the createGitHubClient function to also support reading owner/repo from env vars if needed for consistency
Run lint checks to ensure code quality
Update README.md with instructions for setting up the .env file

potential_risks: Users will lose the ability to dynamically switch repositories without restarting the application
NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix exposes environment variables to the client-side browser bundle, which is a security consideration for the token
If .env file is not configured, the app will fail to load issues - need proper error handling
